required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Blood Flow Restriction Therapy in Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Blood Flow Restriction Therapy in Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of blood restriction therapy by comparing increase in muscle mass and strength in patients that receive blood restriction therapy to patients who receive a placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Increase in Muscle Mass Measured by Biodex
primary_outcome.description: Biodex dynamometer is used under standard of care to measure the extensor strength of both legs and have bilateral thigh circumference measured

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in Pain measured by Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: 100-mm horizontal line anchored at one end with the words "no pain" and at the other end with the words "worst pain imaginable."

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with Patellopain syndrome with Cuff
arm_group.description: Patient will be prescribed to 6 weeks of physical therapy with a cuff around the affected leg during exercises

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with Patellopain syndrome with Placebo Cuff

intervention.description: Patients will be receiving blood flow restriction therapy with a pressure cuff set to a placebo pressure setting.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with Patellopain syndrome with Placebo Cuff

intervention.intervention_name: Personalized Tourniquet System for Blood Flow Restriction
intervention.description: Patients will be receiving blood flow restriction therapy with a pressure cuff
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with Patellopain syndrome with Cuff

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA class I-II
- Diagnosed with patellofemoral pain syndrome
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with confirmed radiographic evidence explaining knee pain
- Legally incompetent or mentally impaired (e.g. minors, Alzheimer's subjects, dementia, etc.)
- Younger than 18 years of age or older than 65
- Any patient considered a vulnerable subject
- Patients with impaired circulation, peripheral vascular compromise, Previous revascularization of the extremity, or severe hypertension
- Patients with Sickle cell anemia or venous thromboembolism
- Patients with Sickle cell anemia or venous thromboembolism
- Patients with cancer or Lymphectomies
- Patients with increased intracranial pressure

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results reported in this article, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices).
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 3 months and ending 5 years following article publication.
